hints.content:
Each [[☃ image 1]] equals $\blueD{2}$ apples.

So, [[☃ image 2]] equals $\blueD1$ apple.

We need to count how many pictures are across from Pink Lady.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $\maroonD{2}$ full pictures and a $\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$ picture across from Pink Lady. 
 
$(\maroonD2\times2) + \maroonD1 = \maroonD{5}$

There are $\maroonD{5}$ Pink Lady apples.

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of apples and the vertical axis labeled Apple type. Each apple type is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Granny Smith, Gala, Fiji, Rome, and Pink Lady. The number of apples for each apple type is represented by the number of apple pictures plotted on the graph. Granny Smith is represented by 1 and 1 half apple pictures, Gala is represented by 3 and 1 half apple pictures, Fiji is represented by 6 apple pictures, Rome is represented by 1 apple picture, and Pink Lady is represented by 2 and 1 half apple pictures. The apple pictures for Pink Lady are labeled 1, 2, and one half. !

hints.content:
Now we need to find how many apples there were of each kind. 

[[☃ image 1]]

Kind of apple| Number of [[☃ image 2]]| Number of apples
:- | :-: | :-
$\maroonD{\text{Pink Lady}}$ | $2\dfrac12$ | $({2} \times\blueD2) + 1=\maroonD{5}$
$\purpleD{\text{Rome}}$ | $1$ | $1\times\blueD2=\purpleD2$
$\greenD{\text{Fiji}}$ | $6$ | $6\times\blueD2 =\greenD{12}$
$\goldE{\text{Gala}}$ | $3\dfrac12$ | $(3\times\blueD2) + 1 =\goldE{7}$
$\redD{\text{Granny Smith}}$ | $1\dfrac12$ | $(1\times\blueD2) + 1 =\redD{3}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of apples and the vertical axis labeled Apple type. Each apple type is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Granny Smith, Gala, Fiji, Rome, and Pink Lady. The number of apples for each apple type is represented by the number of apple pictures plotted on the graph. Granny Smith is represented by 1 and 1 half apple pictures, Gala is represented by 3 and 1 half apple pictures, Fiji is represented by 6 apple pictures,  Rome is represented by 1 apple picture, and Pink Lady is represented by 2 and 1 half apple pictures. The apple pictures for Granny Smith are labeled 1, and one half. The apple pictures for Gala are labeled 1, 2, 3, and one half. The apple pictures for Fiji are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. The apple picture for Rome is labeled 1. The apple pictures for Pink Lady are labeled 1, 2, and one half. !

hints.content:
Before Karen ate any Fiji apples, there were $\greenD{12}$ apples.  Then she ate $5$ apples.

$\greenD{12} -5 = {7}$ apples

After that, there were $\greenD{7}$ Fiji apples.

Before Karen dropped apples, there were $\goldE{7}$ Gala apples. Then she dropped ${4}$ apples.

$\goldE{7} - 4 ={3}$ apples

After that, there were $\goldE{3}$ apples.
Which two types of apples have the same number of apples after these changes?
After Karen ate and dropped apples, the **Gala**  and the **Granny Smith** apples had the same number of apples.

question.content:
Karen picked apples at the Carter Apple Orchard this weekend. She made a graph to show how many apples she picked.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

Karen ate $5$ Fiji apples and dropped $4$ Gala apples.

**After Karen ate and dropped those apples, which two types have the same number of apples?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of apples and the vertical axis labeled Apple type. Each apple type is listed along the vertical axis from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Granny Smith, Gala, Fiji, Rome, and Pink Lady. The number of apples for each apple type is represented by the number of apple pictures plotted on the graph. Granny Smith is represented by 1 and 1 half apple pictures, Gala is represented by 3 and 1 half apple pictures, Fiji is represented by 6 apple pictures, Rome is represented by 1 apple picture, and Pink Lady is represented by 2 and 1 half apple pictures. !
